snippet: With all the festivities packed into the All-Star weekend, the game itself has become just one entertainment option. It was not always this way, according to former players.
abstract: NBA's All-Star weekend, taking place in New York City for first time since 1998, offers such a multitude of social and business events for players that All-Star Game itself seems to have taken on an air of nonchalance; former NBA players recall far more competitive All-Star Game, with East and West teams each racking up more points than the average for regular-season games.
lead_paragraph: With all the festivities packed into the All-Star weekend, the game itself has become just one entertainment option. It was not always this way, according to former players.

headline.seo: Past N.B.A. All-Stars Recall a More Competitive Game
headline.main: Evolution From Modest Start to a Bonanza
headline.print_headline: Evolution From Modest Start to a Bonanza
